fol.265r
A l
re
to M
r
Bodeley.
S
r
Edward Norreys
Governo
r
of
Ostend
hathe made humble suite unto us that for the better
defence of that place (in respecte the Ennemy hathe againe erected
the fortes that formerlie were wont to blocke up the passages
aboute the same. whereby the Ennemy makethe attempt
even
to the gates and there kill and distresse the Sentelnells, and
Companie of horse might be sent to reside in that Garrison where
upon order is given that the Companie of
S
r
John Pooley
nowe
remayning at
Bergen opt Zome
shall forthew
th
repare to
Ostende
.
And because they are to be
vided of convenient shipping for
their transportac
o
n of the States. we have thought good to requier
you p
n
telie upon the receipte herof to deale w
th
the
Counsaill of
Estate
that direction be p
n
telie given for some convenient number
of meete and sufficient vessells to be had for their saufe transpor-
tac
o
n, as also of neede be to remove the Companie from
Berghen
to
Ostende
, w
ch
because yt shall be for the benefitt of hir
owne service we doubte not but they will readely accomplishe
Howebeit if you shall find any slacknes in them, you maie not
faile to urge and stirre them thereunto in as earnest manner as
you maie. In the meane tyme we have written o
r
l
re
s to
S
r
Thomas Morgan
to further by all good meanes their passage awaie
where we praie you also to yeild them yo
r
best furderance
that no unnecessary delaie be used. And so we &c.
